meanings.definition: A mark stamped on a piece of mail by postal authorities, typically indicating the date and place of mailing.
meanings.sent1: The postmarks on the envelope showed it was sent from far away.
meanings.sent2: I always look at the postmarks on letters to see where they came from.
meanings.sent3: The postmarks on the package made it look official and important.
meanings.sent4: Her collection of postmarks was like a map of her travels.
meanings.sent5: The postmarks were so clear, they almost told a story of their own.

meanings.sent1: She carefully postmarks each letter before sending it out.
meanings.sent2: The post office postmarks all outgoing mail to ensure it is processed.
meanings.sent3: He postmarks his drawings with a special stamp to show they are his.
meanings.sent4: The artist postmarks his work with a unique symbol for authenticity.
meanings.sent5: The postman postmarks the letters with precision and care.

meanings.sent1: The postmarks of the clerks were neat and tidy.
meanings.sent2: Postmarks require attention to detail to ensure accuracy.
meanings.sent3: The postmarks of the workers were always done in a rush.
meanings.sent4: The postmarks of the team were a testament to their efficiency.
meanings.sent5: The postmarks of the office were a source of pride for the staff.
